elements.title: Grammatica Litvanica (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Daniel Klein's Grammatica Litvanica (pictured), the first printed grammar of the Lithuanian language, introduced the distinctive Lithuanian letter Ė?

elements.title: its namesake station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the riots protesting the destruction of the houses in Nieuwmarkt are memorialised in its namesake station?

elements.title: King Bataha Santiago (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that King Bataha Santiago's parents sent him to school when he was 44 years old?

elements.title: driving in Madagascar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that, due to bandits, convoys of ten or more vehicles are required on some roads when driving in Madagascar?

elements.title: E. Daniel Cherry (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that United States Air Force brigadier general E. Daniel Cherry became close friends with the Vietnamese pilot whom he shot down during the Vietnam War?

elements.title: Achievement Test in English Composition (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the College Entrance Examination Board went back and forth over whether the Achievement Test in English Composition should include an essay component?

elements.title: Sakhela Buhlungu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sakhela Buhlungu's anti-corruption efforts at the University of Fort Hare led to a failed assassination attempt that killed his bodyguard?

elements.title: supermarket scanner moment (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dr. Oz called his veggie tray "crudité" in his supermarket scanner moment?
